abstract: John Swansburg reviews books Back From the Dead by Bill Walton, The Arm: Inside the Billion-Dollar Mystery of the Most Valuable Commodity in Sports by Jeff Passan, Only Rule Is It Has to Work: Our Wild Experiment Building a New Kind of Baseball Team by Ben Lindbergh and Sam Miller, Players by Matthew Futterman, Boys Among Men: How the Prep-to-Pro Generation Redefined the NBA and Sparked a Basketball Revolution by Jonathan Abrams and When Shea Was Home: The Story of the 1975 Mets, Yankees, Giants, and Jets by Brett Topel.
lead_paragraph: Bill Walton’s elegiac yet exuberant new memoir, an investigation of arm injuries in baseball and more.

headline.main: Sports: Bill Walton’s ‘Back From the Dead,’ and More

snippet: Bill Walton’s elegiac yet exuberant new memoir, an investigation of arm injuries in baseball and more.
